channel.title: Nyc on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Nyc on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Stable Rent
item.description: [whitebox] Editor’s note: Hey guys, Ernie here with the latest piece from Andrew Egan, who previously told us about going to the lobby and grabbing ourselves a treat. This time, he’s makin’ hay.   [big]Today in Tedium: People have powerful connections to their pets. They brighten our day and wrack us with worry when they get sick. Whether it’s dogs, cats, parrots, or snakes, people will go to extreme lengths to accommodate their pets.

item.title: We Can Dance If We Want To
item.description: [big]New York City has long been known as a fairly progressive place, one known as welcoming to ethnic and cultural groups long marginalized by society. So it’s surprising that the city’s laws regarding dancing are more appropriate for a small town in an ‘80s movie.[/big] The city’s long, strange aversion to dancing is finally expected to come to an end on October 31st when a prohibition-era law is expected to be repealed.
